entry.title: Help wanted: translations
entry.summary: In this email thread, Gavin Andresen is requesting help to write new translations for the Bitcoin-Qt version 0.5 Release Candidate 1. He explains that all the translations for the old wxWidgets Bitcoin are obsolete and that three translations already exist in Dutch, German, and Russian. The translations are stored in ".ts" files in the src/qt/locale folder, and the 'QT Linguist' tool can be used to create translations. Alternatively, an online tool like Transifex could be used to crowdsource the work. Gavin also asks if anyone is willing to coordinate translation efforts and figure out if Transifex is a good tool to use, and he provides references to GitHub and Qt Linguist's manual page. Thiago responds by offering to translate it to Brazilian Portuguese.
